definition: lit. love the house and its crow (idiom); involvement with sb and everyone connected/Love me, love my dog.
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1],個|个[ge4]
and/to reach/up to/in time for
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
crow/black

sentences.english: Jessie: Is that what they say love me love my dog?
sentences.chinese: 這就是所說的愛屋及烏吧。

sentences.english: Find a way to become part of those things that are of most interest to them, and you will have found a way to become part of their life.
sentences.chinese: 愛屋及烏，你很快就會成爲他們生活的一部分。

sentences.english: Accept and love each others' family and friends.
sentences.chinese: 愛屋及烏，愛相互的家庭和朋友。

sentences.english: It was a case of love me, love my dog.
sentences.chinese: 這真是一個愛屋及烏的例子。

sentences.english: It was a case of love me, love my dog, she wouldn't go unless he was invited.
sentences.chinese: 這是件愛屋及烏之事，她不會去除非他被邀請了。

sentences.english: You know they say, "Love your wife love her dog".
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎，他們說“愛屋及烏”。

sentences.english: My parents love me a lot and I am happy, but I'm scared.
sentences.chinese: 我的父母愛屋及烏了很多，我很高興，但我怕。

definition: to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to go into a huff
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
(coll.) to enjoy showing off
arrogant and despotic
nonsense/ridiculous talk/hogwash
to make a big fuss over a minor issue (idiom)
soft on the inside despite one's hard shell/appearing tough on the outside as to mask one's inner vulnerability/also written 內柔外剛|内柔外刚[nei4 rou2 wai4 gang1]
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
clumsy/all thumbs
can talk really well (idiom); the gift of the gab
to be self-interested
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: affectionate/an affectionate person
